name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Revere Inn & Suites

reviews.title: AVOID THIS HOTEL
reviews.text: This hotel was one of two that I was considering after doing thorough online research of the area. Because it sounded nice and was in a good location, I decided to book reservations online. However, after selecting the room and providing payment information, the web page stuck and would not proceed in processing the reservation. Rather, it went to a "Page Not Found" instead of a receipt with a confirmation number. After another attempt I became aggrevated and decided to make reservations at my second choice, The Inn at Leola Village (which I most highly recommend). The following month, I noticed a charge on my visa bill for 2 nights' stay at the Best Western in Paradise. I called the hotel and spoke with, hands down, the nastiness customer service representative on earth, who told me that I had reserved a room for 2 nights and was a "no show," so I was charged. I tried over and over to explain to her that I did attempt to make a reservation but that it would not go through and I never received any confirmation, but this horrible woman only became more and more aggressive, finally telling me she "didn't really care," that it wasn't her fault, and that I would pay for that room because I reserved it and did not show up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I subsequently wrote to the manager of the hotel and also to the Best Western corporate office (this was a longshot since Best Westerns are privately owned and operated, but I thought they should at least know the low level of customer service being provided at this particular namesake). None of these attempts proved successful, so I paid for 2 nights at a hotel I'd never set foot in, and decided the best I could do is warn everyone I could against staying at this particular hotel. As far as I'm concerned, the people running this place are nothing short of thieves, and nasty ones at that.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Very Poor Customer Service
reviews.text: This hotel was great. If you stay in the main house, they are suites, and you pay a little more. The annex is a short walk from the main house and now that we are aware of where it is, wouldn't hesitate to stay there. The room was very large, with king bed, and sitting room with sofa and chair. Morning breakfast was very good and more than satisfying. We had plans to go to the American Music Theater and it was a short drive down the highway. We would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

We had booked a three day stay at this hotel the end of March 2011. We asked for and received a handicap room. At the time of booking I had called to ask if there was a microwave in the room and I was told that there would be one there. Upon arrival there was no microwave. One was brought to us by the maintenance staff that discovered there was no available outlet to plug it into and off they went to locate an extension cord. We went out for dinner and requested that they wait until we returned to install the microwave with the extension cord. When we returned we received an extension cord from the front desk with only one receptacle. As the cord should have had two receptacles due to the amount of appliances it had to hold, I contacted the front desk. I was informed that because we had requested no one be in our room while we were out that is why the cord was wrong. The young man at the desk was extremely rude so I asked to speak to the manager. When she came on the line, she too was very rude. She said she didn't understand electrical problems and would have to have someone investigate..........hhhhmmmmm......what was there to understand? Either a new extension cord that could hold two plugs or a longer cord that could run to the next outlet. Then I was told that they didn't put microwaves in the handicap rooms due to the safety issues BUT..........the bathroom counter, where the sink and water were, held an electric coffee pot and was regular height........the "handicap" bath was not a shower but a regulation tub that you had to step over.......sure didn't make sense to us. The manager was so nasty that we left the hotel and stayed at the Amish Inn and Suites. There we received excellent customer service.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay - good value

reviews.text: Comfortable and clean . Folks (employees) at breakfast are pleasent and helpful. Housekeepers did great job.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the location, it was on a quiet road, very close to everthing you could possibly want to do or see. If you want a "closer to the action" hotel, stay at the Best Western in Intercourse, PA. Also a great hotel. The room was perfect, great staff, 2 pools, very quiet and felt very save. Will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: GREAT LOCATION TO SEE IT ALL IN AMISH COUNTRY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay here. Nice comfortable, spacious rooms. Large screen TV with nice sitting area, plus another tv by bed. Breakfast was good, but the eating area was really crowded. Went down three times before we could find a place to sit. Egg sausage sandwiches to heat and a waffle maker. Coffee and tea available all the time. Would defintely stay again.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel. We stayed in the main building and the rooms were clean and nicely furnished. The staff was extremely helpful especially Kendall who was at the front desk. The breakfast buffet had a good variety of food, including waffles and a fruit bowl.The staff maintaining the breakfast bar were constantly cleaning the area and refilling the food. The hotel is near strasburg, intercourse, and bird in hand. I will definitely stay here again when I am in the area.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night over Memorial Day weekend 2011. We had one room with 2 queen beds for 4 adults. Check-in was fine with no issues, even received 2 free bottles of water since I belonged to the Best Western loyalty program (which is free). The room was quite large and we had no issues with 4 adults. It was nice as the area right outside the bathroom had a 6 feet wall and a small desk to put on make-up. It was great as my mother-in-law liked to leave the bathroom light on and the 6 foot wall covered it well and made it possible to sleep through the night even though the light was on.
reviews.title: Great hotel, friendly staff, good location

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good and had quite a large selection. I had a self made waffle, cereal, and a donut. They also had toast, breakfast sandwiches and yogurt. The coffee and hot water for tea were out 24 hours a day which the in-laws loved. At breakfast they also had juice, hot chocolate, and water. Breakfast was definitely filling and tasty.
reviews.title: Will definately stay again.

reviews.text: There is an indoor pool and jacuzzi but we just didn't have time to use it but it appeared to be in very good condition. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: We loved it and will be back!

reviews.text: Stayed here 3 days 2 nights. We stayed at the annex building. We were traveling with our 3 year old daughter so we booked a room with double beds. The room was very clean, the beds were very comfortable, wi-fi was available. I dont know if it was the time of year but it was really quiet, we were able to sleep very comfortabley and soundly. The continental breakfast was good. There is an outdoor pool right across the annex building which is very convinient if you just want to go for a dip in the pool (sadly we didnt get to use it). The front desk staff is very friendly. Cheking in and out was a breeze. Definately will stay here again.
reviews.title: Good location, Nice grounds, OK room

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel with a great restaurant. Food great, service great, and very nice room. We will be back.
reviews.title: Great Stay and Awesome Wedding Reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been loyal to Starwood for many years, I started exploring other hotel options due to the economy and the fact that Starwood has been closing down a lot of its "affordable" hotels. It was a last minute decision to go to Lancaster for Labor Day weekend and I was so glad to find this hotel after some internet researches. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. No wait at all. We stayed at Room 315 which was a room with king size bed and a separate sitting area. The bathroom was spotless. There was a separate vanity/make up area outside of the bathroom with a chair/stool. We were amazed by the size of the room, and the fact that there were two TV's in the room and one could be easily hooked with PlayStation. The wireless worked perfectly. We used both the indoor and outdoor pools. It was late in the afternoon and we were the only two in the outdoor pool. Complimentary breakfast was close to the quality of what being offered in Element, of not better. The breakfast area was small, but trays were offered so we could easily bring the food up to our room to enjoy. Yes, TRAYS! The hotel does put everything in consideration. So many times when I had breakfast buffet at other hotels, I wished trays were offered so that I didn't need to make multiple trips to carry drinks, food, utensils, etc. to the table. Our only complaint was the carpet, both in the hallway and in the room, was kind of dirty. We definitely would recommend this hotel for those who travels to the area.
reviews.title: I might ditch Starwood soon!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed as part of a wedding group in September. My husband and I were put in a room in the main building. As others have noted, the property is quite lovely and the location very convenient. However, we had three main concerns:
reviews.title: Great Location but Staff, Beds, Amenities Need Work

reviews.text: 1. The staff was not accommodating to simple requests and was not welcoming at all. When we first tried to check in, we were told our room was not ready, despite the fact that we had called days earlier to advise that we would be arriving earlier in the day (12:00 instead of 3:00 check-in time). We understood that the hotel could only accommodate us if they had a room available. However, the staff was dismissive, saying only "Come back later and try again." I asked what time, and she said 3:00. I said we were part of the wedding party and the wedding started at 4:00, which would not give us enough time to shower, get ready, and arrive at the church on time (we had driven 3 hours from DC that morning and the church was another 20 minutes away). The desk attendant literally looked at me and shrugged. Horrible customer service -- and I am a Best Western Rewards member. We ended up checking in at 2:30 and rushed to get ready but arrived on time.
reviews.title: Exceptional value. Indoor/outdoor pool...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The room, once we got checked in, was old, musty and damp, and the beds were absolutely atrocious. I did not sleep at all that night. In addition, though the room was damp, it was also freezing and we could not adjust the temperature. The bedspread and chairs in the rooms were stained and the toilet looked like it had been "wiped clean".
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.text: 3. The breakfast space was much too small to accommodate even just the main building guests--perhaps about 20-25 people could eat at one time. We did not get a table and there were no benches in the lobby or outside, so we walked to the annex and sat on the steps to eat.
reviews.title: Good hotel for a good price
